titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5020) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2007 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, the Community Management Account, and the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-438, by Mr. Putnam.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5020. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 167.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 774.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 228 - 194 (Roll no. 102).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 227 - 198 (Roll no. 103).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/26/2006--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5020 (Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2007).
